activity_1_b.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වචන නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_d.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_e.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

content.sentence_text: The workers are building a new house now.
The ground floor is almost ready.
Rainwater runs off after the shower.
A cow often grazes near this site.

activity_2.focus: Focus Contrast between the Simple Present Tense and the Present Continuous Tense

example.text:
Listen to the model dialogue.
ආදර්ශ සංවාදයට සවන් දෙන්න.
மாதிரி உரையாடலை கேளுங்கள்.

activity_2_a.text:
Match the words with the pictures.
පදයන් පින්තූර සමග ගැලපන්න.
சொற்களைப் படங்களுடன் பொருத்துங்கள்.

activity_2_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_2_d.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

activity_2_e.text:
Read the answer and use the pause to ask the correct question. Then compare your response with the model question.
 පිළිතුර කියවා නිවැරදි ප්‍රශ්නය ඇසීමට විරාමය භාවිතා කරන්න. ඉන්පසු ඔබේ පිළිතුර ආදර්ශ පිළිතුර සමඟ සසඳන්න.
 பதிலைக் கவனமாக வாசித்து, இடைவெளியில் சரியான கேள்வியை கேளுங்கள். பின்னர் உங்கள் கேள்வியை மாதிரி கேள்வியுடன் ஒப்பிடவும்.

tables: I am crying because I am sad.
I always cry when I am sad.

example_dialogues.text_a: Why are you drinking king coconut?
example_dialogues.text_b: I am drinking it because I am dehydrated.
example_dialogues.text_c: I always drink it when I am dehydrated.

example_dialogues.text_a: Why are you biting your lips?
example_dialogues.text_b: I am biting them because I’m nervous.
example_dialogues.text_c: I always bite my lips when I am nervous.

example_dialogues.text_b: I am lying down because I am exhausted.
example_dialogues.text_c: I always lie down when I am exhausted.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you cleaning the tools?
dialogues.text_b: I’m cleaning them because they are dirty.
dialogues.text_c: I always clean them after work.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you wearing the helmet?
dialogues.text_b: I’m wearing it because it’s safe.
dialogues.text_c: I always wear it at the site.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you mixing the cement now?
dialogues.text_b: We’re mixing it because we need mortar.
dialogues.text_c: We always mix it before laying bricks.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you checking the scaffolding?
dialogues.text_b: I’m checking it because it looks loose.
dialogues.text_c: I always check it before climbing.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you measuring the beam?
dialogues.text_b: I’m measuring it because it must be exact.
dialogues.text_c: I always measure things twice before cutting.

dialogues.text_a: Why are you covering the bricks?
dialogues.text_b: I’m covering them because it might rain.
dialogues.text_c: I always cover them at the end of the day.

activity_a.text:
Choose the correct answer.
 නිවැරදි පිළිතුර තෝරන්න.
 சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

activity_b.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

content.sentence_1: The baby ______ because it is hungry.
content.sentence_2: It always ______ when it is hungry.
content.full_sentance: The baby is crying because it is hungry. It always cries when it is hungry.

content.sentence_2: She always ______ when she is angry.
content.full_sentance: She is screaming because she is angry. She always screams when she is angry.

content.sentence_2: They always ______ when they are cold.
content.full_sentance: They are shivering because they are cold. They always shiver when they are cold.

content.sentence_1: He ______ his nails because he is nervous.
content.sentence_2: He always ______ his nails when he is nervous.
content.full_sentance: He is biting his nails because he is nervous. He always bites his nails when he is nervous.

content.sentence_1: She ______ her eyes because she is scared.
content.sentence_2: She always ______ her eyes when she is scared.
content.full_sentance: She is closing her eyes because she is scared. She always closes her eyes when she is scared.

content.sentence_1: The trainees ______ because they are hot.
content.sentence_2: They always ______ when they are hot.
content.full_sentance: The trainees are sweating because they are hot. They always sweat when they are hot.

activity_b.text: The baby is crying because it is hungry. It always cries when it is hungry.
She is screaming because she is angry. She always screams when she is angry.
They are shivering because they are cold. They always shiver when they are cold.
He is biting his nails because he is nervous. He always bites his nails when he is nervous.
She is closing her eyes because she is scared. She always closes her eyes when she is scared.
The trainees are sweating because they are hot. They always sweat when they are hot.

activity_a.text:
Listen to the audio which will be played twice and click on the correct answer. It is very important that you read the questions before you listen to the recording.
ඔබට සෑම පටිගත කිරීමක්ම දෙවරක් ඇසෙනු ඇත. නිවැරදි පිළිතුර ක්ලික් කරන්න. රෙකෝඩින් එක අහන්නට පෙර ප්‍රශ්නය කියවීම ඉතාමත් වැදගත්ය.
ஒவ்வொரு ஒலிப்பதிவையும் நீங்கள் இருமுறை கேட்கலாம். கேட்ட எண்களை குறித்து எழுதுங்கள். பதிவைக் கேட்பதற்கு முன் கேள்விகளைப் படிப்பது மிகவும் முக்கியம்.

activity_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_d.text: Read along. පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න. ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

Questions.question: Why is Amali starting work earlier today?
Questions.answer: Because the site supervisor is checking safety equipment
options: Because the site supervisor is checking safety equipment
Because the site supervisor is checking the machinery

Questions.question: Why is she mixing concrete this morning?
Questions.answer: Because the masons need extra mortar
options: Because she is repairing the store wall
Because the masons need extra mortar
Because the masons are too busy with other tasks

Questions.question: Why is she sharing tools with Ruwan?
Questions.answer: Because her toolbox is locked in the store
options: Because he forgot his own tools
Because her toolbox is locked in the store
Because the instructor asked them to work together

Questions.question: Why is she wearing a reflective vest today?
Questions.answer: Because heavy vehicles are operating near the gate
options: Because the site manager gave her a new one
Because heavy vehicles are operating near the gate
Because heavy vehicles are not very safe today

Questions.question: Why is she covering the bricks with a tarpaulin this afternoon?
Questions.answer: Because dark clouds are gathering and it might rain
options: Because she wants to protect them from dust
Because dark clouds are gathering and it might rain
Because the instructor told her to take a break

activity_b.text: Amali works at a construction site in Kurunegala.
She starts work at seven-thirty every morning, but today she is starting earlier because the site supervisor is checking the safety equipment.
She usually begins her day by marking measurements on the foundation, but this morning she is mixing concrete because the masons need extra mortar for the wall.
She normally uses her own trowel and measuring tape, but today she is sharing tools with her teammate Ruwan because her toolbox is locked in the store.
She always wears her helmet and safety boots, but now she is wearing a reflective vest too because heavy vehicles are operating near the gate.
Most days, Amali lays bricks and checks levels with the spirit level, but this week she is plastering a new wall section inside the training block.
She usually carries sand and cement bags to the mixer, but today she is unloading bricks because the supplier delivered a new batch in the morning.
She normally gets the help of her friends for a job like this, but today they are all busy with other work around the site, so she is doing it herself.
At the end of the day, she always cleans the tools and stacks the wheelbarrows, but this afternoon she is covering the bricks with a tarpaulin because dark clouds are gathering and it might rain.
She enjoys her training because she learns new building techniques every week, and she is becoming more confident at managing tasks on her own.
